metadata.title: CVE-2017-17523 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
lilypond-invoke-editor in LilyPond 2.19.80 does not validate strings beforelaunching the program specified by the BROWSER environment variable, whichallows remote attackers to conduct argument-injection attacks via a craftedURL, as demonstrated by a --proxy-pac-file argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17523` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lilypond - 2.18.2-12build1
lilypond-data - 2.18.2-12build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lilypond package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.2-12build1').
